Several alarms go off inside Tucson's cab Quickstride reads a display panne=
l which shows where the damage has taken place.

"Woahh, we gotta do someth=
ing before you overheat!"

He looks around and then finds an internal extin=
guisher control unit, and programs it to send coolant to the grill plating,=
 easing off the caustic nature of the insects' attack.

" When life turns u=
p the heat, you simply lower the temperature"

Was his reaction to the dama=
ge which he sustains.

"I'll get that taken care of when I get back to base=
... Nowww, I don't think I should be going easy on these insects.."

Tucson=
 positions himself solidly with front tires pivoted toward the left, and tr=
ailer in a diagonal position.  He was going to attempt something he had nev=
er done before with his sonar systems.  He attempts to amplify the signal v=
ia trailer speakers, to see if that would immobilize the insects long enoug=
h to allow himself and the group to continue uninterrupted.

Straight Shot =
could tell what he was up to. Simply because before the accident, none of t=
hem ever separated from each other during a tough battle.  As his sister, s=
he knew when her big brother was up to something substantial.

" He's posit=
ioned a pair of trailer amplifiers.  Perceptor, sorry, but you'll want to t=
urn off the audio sensors again.  Ohhh, he's only done this one other time =
and lemme tell ya, you want sonic boom you got it."

She turns off her audi=
o sensors also, as does Quickstride who can actually surmise what Tucson Pr=
ime was now up to.

" I wanna keep my ears thanks very much."

Tucson provi=
des a count down until deployment of his amplified sonar attack.

" It look=
s like someone ignorred my warning shots.  I hate to do this but you leave =
me with no choice."

Everyone waits as the count down draws closer to finis=
hing.
